title: Goal in Selecting a Sample
question_text: Which of the following best describes the goal in selecting a sample as a means of providing information about a specific population of interest?

choices.text: The sample should contain individuals who are as similar as possible.
The sample should contain individuals who are as diverse as possible.
The sample should represent the population of interest as accurately as possible.
The sample should include those individuals that are as easy to reach as possible.
The sample should include those individuals who are most eager to participate as possible.

correct_answer: In order to better understand (and be able to conduct valid statistical inference about) a specific population of interest, it is most important that we collect our data from a sample that best represents that specific population of interest. In this way, we will be able to generalize the results of the study to the population that we are concerned with.
